intro: Pycnocomon intermedium, commonly known as the intermediate pygmyweed, is a small flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that help it store water. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically yellow or greenish in color, adapted to attract specific pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific environmental requirements, it is considered a rare and sensitive species.
